sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph: 

![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/vqzgMFh.png)

Find a Hamiltonian cycle in this graph if it exists.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once. Let's try to find a Hamiltonian cycle in the given graph. We can label the nodes as A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I for easier reference.

One possible Hamiltonian cycle in this graph is:

A → B → C → D → E → F → G → H → I → A

So, the graph does have a Hamiltonian cycle.
